reviewText:
Early Access Review

Under Zero is supposed to be an Early Access survival game in arctic conditions. You're supposed to find a way to escape by activating the beacon. No surprise there, the achievement tells you that. However, getting anything done in the game is kind of a joke.

You walk around in the snow, with the ever present crunch crucnh of your boots as you plod along, hoping that the below zero temperatures will end your suffering. Unfortunately, they don't. While other people have obviously died, you are invincible. However, don't get stuck in a pit, because though you can survive long falls, and look inside wolves brains, you cannot jump or climb to save your life. Not that your life is in any danger, only one wolf seems able to kill you.

Story: Non-existent.

Sounds: Crunch crunch is what you'll hear most of the time. Unless the random wanna be creepy music kicks in suddenly... and then you'll still hear the crunch crunch but at a subdued volume. Wolves are totally silent. Walking up one set of wooden stairs, reveals that you're half a thief. One foot makes no noise and the other makes tons of noise. Mom always said, not to replace your limbs with stranger's body parts. Storms instantly kick in and instantly cease. There is no rise or fall in volume level.

Graphics: I have no idea what is going on here. While you're walking around, your arm sticks out.... The game is made up of square shapes for the most part, that sometimes overlap causing weird issues as the devs didn't bother to shorten them so they wouldn't stick through each other. While the SNOW is okay.... pretty much just really bad for everything else.

Gameplay: What gameplay? Try putting something heavy on your up arrow or w key and walking away then come back in a bit, you might have found a building. You cannot jump, though the config tool clearly shows a jump setting. You cannot crouch, so some items are impossible to retrieve. You have no cross hair option, so you have no idea if you're pointing at what you want and it just doesn't respond, or if you just can't interact with it. The controls themsevles are just a joke. There is nothing to tell you what they are, except the config tool at the beginning and even then, it doesn't cover everything. I have no idea how to make a fire either, though apparently T is the key for that. I'm not sure how I managed to fire my gun off, because I seemed to press buttons that didn't do antyhing before, but then suddenly I could shoot once I'd pressed H to get my rifle out. I have zero ideas how to select any other item in the inventory.

I've met 3 wolves. Only one apparently has teeth. Though the others jump at me, obviously they just want to lick my face while smiling very big because they are so adorable. You can see through their heads if you get close enough and face them. There is no map or anything. I could go on and on and on, but what's the point? In this case, it's just a really bad game and nothing works.

Oh, one other thing, if you go to settings in the menu, you can essentially choose graphic quality. Your choices are Standard, something else that sounds appropriate and Height.... wtf? I know they mean, High, but seriously?

Overall: 2/10 - At least it runs? Seriously, stay the hell away from this game. Don't even get it for free. Though it's advertised as Early Access, this is not even ready to be in that stage of development. This game needs a lot of work, and the dev is basically silent on the forums. Congratulations, people paid for your game and you stopped talking to them... that or you're just sitting there counting funds.

Do Not Get This Game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I found a wolf that appeared to be attacking me but making no sound or doing damage or showing any sign that I was actually being attacked other than the biting animation. This wolf followed me to the first house I found, I picked up a bottle of water then went to leave the building, the wolf was glitching in the air in front of the door and now I am stuck in this building. This is the reason I only have about 12 minutes played in this game.

Other things I noticed:

Repetitive annoying snow crunching sound persists even if you're in a building or on a road that has no snow on it
I can open what I think is the inventory with tab but I have to press escape then to use the mouse, but then I can't do anything with items
Is right click punch, push? If you hold right click then left click it extends the arm a little further. Not sure what either of these actually do
If you use the mouse you must hit escape after each time you click because the mouse disappears
In my 12 minutes I found a wolf that attempted to attack then was followed into a building I found and got stuck in
I would strongly discourage anyone purchasing this game in the current state it is in. If it is completely overhauled I could see it being a cool adventure/exploration game but I wouldn't even consider it the skeleton of that in its current state.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pros:
Maybe a little bit more interesting than watching paint dry.
You can easily uninstall it.
It has trading cards and they do drop.

Cons:
There is nothing to do in the entire game. You just pick up items you can't use. You collect log and fuel and can't have a fire, you have a sweater you cannot wear, you get food and water that can't be used and a bunch of other equally useless junk. The only two things that can be used are the flashlight that offers nothing whatsoever but you can hold it and the rifle which can be used to kill a wolf. Only one wolf, the first one you encounter. There are actually two wolves in the game but the second one won't even interact. And the one that does interact just barks at you but can't attack because nothing can kill you in that game. So you can kill a defenseless animal that is no threat and walk around in a terribly made icy place. Until you hit the invisible walls that is. Two out of three achievements are impossible and the game crashed the first two times I attempted launching it plus it's hard to even exit the game with the way the menu kinda works. Oh and you'd think a game looking so simple with a small map and nothing to do would be light, right? Wrong! It takes way more processing power than it should be taking. The whole game is a cruel joke to whoever buys it. It's still early access so I was going to give it a pity thumb up without even trying it before official release but then I saw the comments and thought come on
date: how bad can it be?" and the anwer is "very very bad". I got it for free and got 3 cards out of it but still regret actually trying to play it. Having an accidental pet wolf is not worth the hussle. I'll change this review to a positive one if somehow the game is fixed and we can actually do something but I'm pretty sure it's beyond salvation. Devs don't rush to release something

not even in early access when it's so underdeveloped. All that gets is negative reviews.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Early Access Watcher Reviews Under Zero

Update Version: Initial

Disclosure: The game copy was bought by the reviewer through a bundle.

I have been examining the Early Access program for about a year now and can easily locate the tell tale signs of certain categories the games released end up falling into. It is a known fact there are plenty of older titles still wasting away on the store page with no activity while others try tooth and nail to prolong their stay in the status despite no real progress. It is a terrible realization when you think of all the potential developers that could be helped with the aid of Early Access that are stained with the stigma the last couple of years have built with abandoned products. One reason this happens is due to a title being released into Early Access too soon and Under Zero is a clear example of it.

Unity has become a dangerous warning light when  Early Access come to mind and it seemed to be an accurate one. Visually the game is nothing special with the snowy landscape populated by rectangular shapes and some none boxy trees. You spawn next to a lighthouse that is somewhat difficult to climb due to the boxy shapes of the stairs overlapping each other. A few squarish buildings exist outside as well with some items, but they are also poorly designed with the potential of getting stuck. Invisible walls outline the boundary of the region which is inhabited by some decent looking wolves, but they clip into themselves, constantly chase you without hurting you or just stand there looking at you. One of the wolves followed me and managed to trap me inside a building (I could not walk through or past it). The design choices and layout feel as if it was all done in a afternoon without any fine rendering.

Music was non-existent for the first half of my initial and secondary play through with the load clumping of your footsteps making up the entirety of the soundtrack. There is a flashlight and a gun, but the gun lacks a basic design. Other items exist, but have no purpose (cherry soda for example). Settings for the game also seem off putting and confusing with the graphical setting for high spelled Height (at least I think high is what it is suppose to represent). The cursor disappears when you open the menu in-game unless you hit the ESC key while the character model still has the ability to look around. To even say this game lacks content is being overly generous: there is no content. It might have achievements (almost all are bugged) and trading cards, but these are not selling points.

For a game with no content and very low tier graphics, it sure has some performance issues. The game managed to crash on me a couple of times and the loading screen froze when I tried entering the game from the main menu. I already mentioned the fact you can be trapped by a wolf in the buildings, but the glitchy nature of the wolf needs addressing,again. The AI is non-existent as well, just endless chasing or standing. This really is the bare-basic concept of a game I have seen on Early Access, which is the worst thing you could say.

Any program can be founded on good intentions, but it doesn't mean those intentions will protect it from games that slip through the cracks. I am told often you cannot judge a game by what it is, but instead from what it will become. It is that mindset that creates the problems Early Access has right now and those issues will not stop unless people start taking responsibility. I am not saying the developer for Under Zero is in the wrong here by releasing the game in this state, but it is up to the developer to reflect on how the game functions at the moment and act on it. It takes a great person to know when something is not worth the price of admission and work toward making something that is before selling it. Under Zero shouldn't be in Early Access in the state it is in, especially at the price it is asking. I really hope it can prove me wrong in my assumptions of what category it will end up in down the line, but very few games have so far.

Pros

- None

Cons

- No Content
- Crashes and Loading Screen Freezes
- Graphical glitches
- Game breaking errors (wolf and floor boards trapping in building)
- Music and sound issues
- Settings
- No Gameplay
- No Purpose

reviewText:
Early Access Review

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a8ZVlRBeIlM

Devoid of basically any content, Under Zero lacks anything for the player to actually do apart from opening doors and picking up items.

You can't equip any items you find, nor can you use them. You cannot die, enemies cannot hurt you, and you cannot consume food. You cannot win and you cannot lose. There is nothing to do.

You just walk around.

Also, the game functions poorly on a technical level. For a game with basically nothing in it, it runs like garbage.

You can get stuck perpetually in staircases and quitting the game involves Ctrl-Alt-Deleting for the Task Manager, as your mouse becomes lose when you try to go back to the main menu.

Worthless game, devoid of any level of quality or enjoyability. Just another Unity based cashgrab. Utter garbage.

This game is like Metin2 it is the same! They have normal wolves  (in store screens) and blue wolves (in game because they don't know how to draw a wolf ....) so it's like Metin2!  What i like in this game is you are in Sohan Mountain fighting with new creatures it's the best game ever and what I like so much is that you are invincible the wolves can't give you damage! reviewText:
Early Access Review

DEAR READER: DO NOT BUY THIS GAME!

This is a game that is very much looking like a ROBLOX game created by someone that doesn't know what to do. You put in a gun, which is very useless. It shoots rounds that are pointing upward into the sky no matter what way you're shooting. Also, once you meet the wolve, you can't kill it, and it WILL get you stuck.

This game has a lack of graphics (8-bit games are better), lack of controls (no crouch/no jump), lack of direction (where to go?!). The point is also way too unclear. What do I do, where do I go? This game, on a rating: 1/10. The 1 is for the effort, which you actually shouldn't deserve.

If this game is created by new creators get this off steam, upload it to kickstarter and try to get it better. This is not good at all, and actually want a refund because this is NOT worth the money!

Early Access Review

That game is terriblle!
Do not buy this game unless you wanna get blind or torture/blind someone.
Pros and Cons:
-Very bad graphics
-You get blind
+After you get blind you don't have to see the game!
-Only enemy in the game is a wolf, and you can not fight him with your weapon
-I looked up on the updates of the game and then i found out you can equip your weapon with H" and your flashlight with "F"
date:
i equipped my weapon and guess what? You cant even shoot it...
-The map is tiny but it takes 1 hour to go from a place to another..
-All you hear when you walk on snow or not on snow is crunch crunch crunch.
-There is a freaking storm every minute.
-Everytime there is a storm you'll think you get attacked by aliens because of that terrible noise.
+You find out you wasn't getting attacked by aliens.
-You want aliens to attack you insted of playing this game.
-The only settings that you can change in-game is the graphics..
+The music at the end was fine?
+The uninstall button works great!

After I played this game for 70 minutes (rest of the playtime is idle to get the trading cards) I promised to myself i will never do that again...

0/10  Will never play this â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ again"
